definition: ordinary/commonplace/mundane/temporal/of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels)/every/all/whatever/altogether/gist/outline/note of Chinese musical scale
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The supernal ideology will not coexistence with the everyman.
sentences.chinese: 超凡的思想是不會與凡夫俗子共存的。

sentences.english: Everyman, there are who can get rid of "gains and losses, " the word it?
sentences.chinese: 凡夫俗子中，有誰能擺脫“得失”二字呢？

sentences.english: A month ago, he was a man of men .
sentences.chinese: 一個月前，他是一個凡夫俗子。

sentences.english: No matter the common people or repelled ones who all can follow Jesus.
sentences.chinese: 不論凡夫俗子或被唾棄者，都能跟從耶穌。

definition: every living being (Buddhism)/the mass of common people
poor people (idiom)/those who live from hand to mouth
Daoist immortal/supernatural entity/(in modern fiction) fairy, elf, leprechaun etc/fig. lighthearted person
saint/sage/refers to Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]/the current reigning Emperor
to achieve the Dao/to become an immortal
